channel.title: Facebook owns you
channel.description:
- http://www.itworld.com/business/62730/facebook-updates-terms-use-internet-freaks-out Kinda reminded me of Google when I read it. Thoughts? - http://news.cnet.com/8301-17939_109-10166388-2.html Today (17/02/09), Facebook ran a poll asking users whether to change back to old to ToS or not. 6% said no, 38% said I don't know and 56% said yes. They haven't changed their ToS yet but this suggests they are considering changing it. - 18/02/09:
Over the past few days, we have received a lot of feedback about the new terms we posted two weeks ago. Because of this response, we have decided to return to our previous Terms of Use while we resolve the issues that people have raised. For more information, visit the Facebook Blog. If you want to share your thoughts on what should be in the new terms, check out our group Facebook Bill of Rights and Responsibilities.

item.title: Facebook owns you
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

  • they announce to the public every thing you do.

Read full topic

item.title: Facebook owns you
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:22, topic:262685”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=346863.msg2675179#msg2675179 date=1235030532]

Facebook is a failure Myspace wannabe.
All old people use it, though.

I thought Facebook was bigger than Myspace?

anyway, they might be changing it back.
http://news.cnet.com/8301-17939_109-10166388-2.html

…I’d want to verify that.
Myspace is pretty fucking huge.

I’d bet Myspace is used a lot more than Facebook, though.

My space is full of homos and emos…

…

OH SHIT SORRY KANE. but really it is…

Yes, that is ALL it is filled with.
Every single member.
You are a smart person!
[/quote]

Did I say thats all it’s filled with?[/quote]
“My space is full of homos and emos…”

Yah, you did. Full implying there to be no room for any other variations.

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:21, topic:262685”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=346863.msg2673666#msg2673666 date=1234931795]

Facebook is a failure Myspace wannabe.
All old people use it, though.

I thought Facebook was bigger than Myspace?

anyway, they might be changing it back.
http://news.cnet.com/8301-17939_109-10166388-2.html

…I’d want to verify that.
Myspace is pretty fucking huge.

I’d bet Myspace is used a lot more than Facebook, though.
[/quote]

Facebook is MUCH larger and more used than myspace now.

http://blog.compete.com/2009/02/09/facebook-myspace-twitter-social-network/[/quote]
That’s very surprising.
Facebook bores me.
Can’t change layouts or anything.

Read full topic

Facebook is a failure Myspace wannabe.
All old people use it, though.

I thought Facebook was bigger than Myspace?

anyway, they might be changing it back.

CNET – 18 Feb 09

Facebook polls users on service terms update

The social network begins asking its users for their reactions to its recent terms-of-service change. The poll features live results.

[/quote]
…I’d want to verify that.
Myspace is pretty fucking huge.

I’d bet Myspace is used a lot more than Facebook, though.[/quote]

Facebook is MUCH larger and more used than myspace now.

http://blog.compete.com/2009/02/09/facebook-myspace-twitter-social-network/

item.title: Facebook owns you
item.dc:creator: @Scrubs Scrubs
item.description:
@Scrubs wrote:

  • http://www.itworld.com/business/62730/facebook-updates-terms-use-internet-freaks-out
    Kinda reminded me of Google when I read it. Thoughts?

  • http://news.cnet.com/8301-17939_109-10166388-2.html
    Today (17/02/09), Facebook ran a poll asking users whether to change back to old to ToS or not. 6% said no, 38% said I don’t know and 56% said yes. They haven’t changed their ToS yet but this suggests they are considering changing it.

  • 18/02/09:

Over the past few days, we have received a lot of feedback about the new terms we posted two weeks ago. Because of this response, we have decided to return to our previous Terms of Use while we resolve the issues that people have raised. For more information, visit the Facebook Blog.

If you want to share your thoughts on what should be in the new terms, check out our group Facebook Bill of Rights and Responsibilities.

Read full topic
